head.title: Judge Offers Dorismonds Guidance to Get Report

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York
Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Law Enforcement and Security

hedline.hl1: Judge Offers Dorismonds Guidance to Get Report

abstract.p: Request from Patrick M Dorismond's family for copies of his autopsy and toxicology reports is denied but Justice Louise Gruner Gans of New York State Supreme Court in Manhattan says that Mayor Rudolph W Giuliani's public discussion of toxology report created possible legal avenue that family could use to obtain it (S)

block.p: A request from Patrick M. Dorismond's family yesterday for copies of his autopsy and toxicology reports was denied. But Justice Louise Gruner Gans of State Supreme Court in Manhattan said that Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani's public discussion of the contents of the toxicology report created a possible legal avenue the family could use to obtain it.

Derek Sells, a lawyer representing the Dorismond family, said he would file papers seeking the release of the toxicology report under the legal theory the justice outlined. Justice Gruner Gans said the autopsy report should be kept secret until the Manhattan district attorney's office completed its investigation into the fatal shooting of Mr. Dorismond on March 30 by an undercover police officer.

A request from Patrick M. Dorismond's family yesterday for copies of his autopsy and toxicology reports was denied. But Justice Louise Gruner Gans of State Supreme Court in Manhattan said that Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani's public discussion of the contents of the toxicology report created a possible legal avenue the family could use to obtain it.

Derek Sells, a lawyer representing the Dorismond family, said he would file papers seeking the release of the toxicology report under the legal theory the justice outlined. Justice Gruner Gans said the autopsy report should be kept secret until the Manhattan district attorney's office completed its investigation into the fatal shooting of Mr. Dorismond on March 30 by an undercover police officer.

Mr. Sells said the family might exhume Mr. Dorismond's body and have tests done to verify the accuracy of the toxicology report, which said there were small amounts of marijuana in Mr. Dorismond's blood.
